byline.contributor: Reporting was contributed by Nabih Bulos, Aurelien Breeden and Lilia Blaise from Paris; Eric Schmitt from Washington; Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura and Andrew Higgins from Brussels; and Alison Smale from Berlin.
byline.original: By RUKMINI CALLIMACHI, KATRIN BENNHOLD and LAURE FOURQUET

abstract: New evidence emerges concerning Abdelhamid Abaaoud and his militants two weeks after Paris terror attacks, revealing security lapses as group honed their skills and rehearsed their assault; despite increasing alarm about threat, overtaxed security system could not handle what was called 'dartboard terrorism' (Series: State of Terror).
lead_paragraph: The Paris attacks revealed an enemy practicing what one official calls “dartboard terrorism,” hurling multiple lethal darts at a distant target until one hits the mark.

headline.main: How the Paris Attackers Honed Their Assault Through Trial and Error
headline.print_headline: A Plot Honed by Trial and Error

snippet: The Paris attacks revealed an enemy practicing what one official calls “dartboard terrorism,” hurling multiple lethal darts at a distant target until one hits the mark.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
